item.title: Notes on "How to Survive in Gamedev for Eleven Years Without a Hit"
item.description: From the video “How to Survive in Gamedev for Eleven Years Without a Hit”, by Jake Birkett of Grey Alien Games: “But it’s taken nine years to get that much money…it is essential that you think “long tail” about your games.” This 2016 GDC talk is from an indie developer who largely made match-three games. It is presented in a narrative lifestory style. The Key Takes: Sell your game on many stores, even small ones.
